paragraph.paragraph: There are two kinds of libraries in Eiffel: precompiled Eiffel libraries and C libraries.
To use an Eiffel precompiled library:

list.item: In the General tab, enter the location of the precompiled library you want to use in the Precompiled Library field.

You must
10_generating_executables.xml recompile your project for the changes to take effect.

paragraph.note: Note: You can only use one precompiled library at a time in a project. To use more than one, you should precompile all the libraries you want to use together in a single precompiled library.

list.item: In the Externals tab, in the Include path field, type the paths of the header files needed to use the library (pressing the Add button for each).
In the Object file field, type the object files needed to use the library (pressing the Add button for each). These files can be either library files (.lib, .a, etc) or object files (.obj, .o, etc)

You must
10_generating_executables.xml recompile your project for the changes to take effect.
